posts.post_content:
She's the most Izzet of any planeswalker to date, and she has yet to be excessively abused. I'm glad she's back for Return to Ravnica.  
  
Has anyone else noticed that she is insanely good with [Tezzeret's Gambit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret's Gambit)?

Posted By: Fenix. (7/11/2012 7:55:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Her ultimate costs 6, deals 6 damage to 6 targets. 666... Chandra is The Beast.  
  
I think her -2 is the real gamewinner among her abilities. Some spells can win games, some spells *duplicated* can win them **very** quickly. One hit kill with something like [Lava Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Axe) if you have [Furnace of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furnace of Rath) or maybe [Fire Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fire Servant) in play. She's not the ultimate planeswalker, but she's good fun nevertheless.  
  
And no, Benji, I'm pretty damn sure you can't hit the same player for 36 damage. That would just be broken.
posts.html:
Her ultimate costs 6, deals 6 damage to 6 targets. 666... Chandra is The Beast.

I think her -2 is the real gamewinner among her abilities. Some spells can win games, some spells duplicated can win them very quickly. One hit kill with something like Lava Axe if you have Furnace of Rath or maybe Fire Servant in play. She's not the ultimate planeswalker, but she's good fun nevertheless.

And no, Benji, I'm pretty damn sure you can't hit the same player for 36 damage. That would just be broken.

posts.post_content:
She's hot. Literally.  
  
But in all seriousness, she's great. Her +1 means goodbye to so many things (I'm looking at you, [Intrepid Hero](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intrepid Hero)!!), her -2 is very, very fun when your opponent drops a [Cruel Ultimatum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cruel Ultimatum), and her ulty results in some very \*\*\*ed opponents. And for 3R, she's actually one of the only planeswalkers good in an aggro deck. So, to finish, she's sexy, she's powerful, and she's cheap. Me like.  
  
Do you think she'd like to go get some Thai food this Saturday?  
  
  
EDIT: Whoops. Silly me. Thanks, Lord\_Of\_Tresserhorn. Meant to say "When I drop..." But maybe with [Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver), we could find some horribly convoluted way to do it...

posts.post_content:
[Chandra, the Firebrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra, the Firebrand) + [Koth of the Hammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Koth of the Hammer) + [Banefire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Banefire) = OHMYGODTHEY'REACTUALLYONFIRE.  
  
super unlikely to happen but if you run [Koth of the Hammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Koth of the Hammer) and place enough mountains out to pump out chandra and Banefire, pay at least 5 on banefire and you're already looking at some lethal damage. with Koth having the option of just doubling your R mana count you could literally roast someone alive late game and they can't stop you once the Banefire's out. Chandra for the win!
posts.html:
Chandra, the Firebrand + Koth of the Hammer + Banefire = OHMYGODTHEY'REACTUALLYONFIRE.

super unlikely to happen but if you run Koth of the Hammer and place enough mountains out to pump out chandra and Banefire, pay at least 5 on banefire and you're already looking at some lethal damage. with Koth having the option of just doubling your R mana count you could literally roast someone alive late game and they can't stop you once the Banefire's out. Chandra for the win!
